name: UnsafeRawPointer
desc: A raw pointer for accessing untyped data.

items.name: typealias UnsafeRawPointer.Stride
items.desc: A type that represents the distance between two values.

items.name: init?<T>(UnsafeMutablePointer<T>?)
items.desc: Creates a new raw pointer from the given typed pointer.

items.name: init<T>(UnsafePointer<T>)
items.desc: Creates a new raw pointer from the given typed pointer.

items.name: init?(UnsafeMutableRawPointer?)
items.desc: Creates a new raw pointer from the given mutable raw pointer.

items.name: init?<T>(AutoreleasingUnsafeMutablePointer<T>?)
items.desc: Creates a new raw pointer from an AutoreleasingUnsafeMutablePointer instance.

items.name: init<T>(AutoreleasingUnsafeMutablePointer<T>)
items.desc: Creates a new raw pointer from an AutoreleasingUnsafeMutablePointer instance.

items.name: init<T>(UnsafeMutablePointer<T>)
items.desc: Creates a new raw pointer from the given typed pointer.

items.name: init(UnsafeMutableRawPointer)
items.desc: Creates a new raw pointer from the given mutable raw pointer.

items.name: init?<T>(UnsafePointer<T>?)
items.desc: Creates a new raw pointer from the given typed pointer.

items.name: init?(UnsafeRawPointer?)
items.desc: Creates a new pointer from the given pointer.

items.name: init?(OpaquePointer?)
items.desc: Creates a new typed pointer from the given opaque pointer.

items.name: init(OpaquePointer)
items.desc: Creates a new typed pointer from the given opaque pointer.

items.name: init(UnsafeRawPointer)
items.desc: Creates a new pointer from the given pointer.

items.name: init?(bitPattern: Int)
items.desc: Creates a new pointer from the given address, specified as a bit pattern.

items.name: init?(bitPattern: UInt)
items.desc: Creates a new pointer from the given address, specified as a bit pattern.

items.name: var customMirror: Mirror
items.desc: The custom mirror for this instance.

items.name: var debugDescription: String
items.desc: A textual representation of the pointer, suitable for debugging.

items.name: var hashValue: Int
items.desc: The hash value.

items.name: func advanced(by: Int) -> UnsafeRawPointer
items.desc: Returns a value that is offset the specified distance from this value.

items.name: func assumingMemoryBound<T>(to: T.Type) -> UnsafePointer<T>
items.desc: Returns a typed pointer to the memory referenced by this pointer, assuming that the memory is already bound to the specified type.

items.name: func bindMemory<T>(to: T.Type, capacity: Int) -> UnsafePointer<T>
items.desc: Binds the memory to the specified type and returns a typed pointer to the bound memory.

items.name: func deallocate()
items.desc: Deallocates the previously allocated memory block referenced by this pointer.

items.name: func distance(to: UnsafeRawPointer) -> Int
items.desc: Returns the distance from this pointer to the given pointer, counted as instances of the pointerâ€™s Pointee type.

items.name: func hash(into: inout Hasher)
items.desc: Hashes the essential components of this value by feeding them into the given hasher.

items.name: func load<T>(fromByteOffset: Int, as: T.Type) -> T
items.desc: Returns a new instance of the given type, constructed from the raw memory at the specified offset.

items.name: func predecessor() -> UnsafeRawPointer
items.desc: Returns a pointer to the previous consecutive instance.

items.name: func successor() -> UnsafeRawPointer
items.desc: Returns a pointer to the next consecutive instance.

items.name: static func != (UnsafeRawPointer, UnsafeRawPointer) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are not equal.

items.name: static func ... (UnsafeRawPointer) -> PartialRangeFrom<UnsafeRawPointer>
items.desc: Returns a partial range extending upward from a lower bound.

items.name: static func ... (UnsafeRawPointer) -> PartialRangeThrough<UnsafeRawPointer>
items.desc: Returns a partial range up to, and including, its upper bound.

items.name: static func ... (UnsafeRawPointer, UnsafeRawPointer) -> ClosedRange<UnsafeRawPointer>
items.desc: Returns a closed range that contains both of its bounds.

items.name: static func ..< (UnsafeRawPointer) -> PartialRangeUpTo<UnsafeRawPointer>
items.desc: Returns a partial range up to, but not including, its upper bound.

items.name: static func ..< (UnsafeRawPointer, UnsafeRawPointer) -> Range<UnsafeRawPointer>
items.desc: Returns a half-open range that contains its lower bound but not its upper bound.

items.name: static func < (UnsafeRawPointer, UnsafeRawPointer) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is less than that of the second argument.

items.name: static func <= (UnsafeRawPointer, UnsafeRawPointer) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is less than or equal to that of the second argument.

items.name: static func == (UnsafeRawPointer, UnsafeRawPointer) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are equal.

items.name: static func > (UnsafeRawPointer, UnsafeRawPointer) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is greater than that of the second argument.

items.name: static func >= (UnsafeRawPointer, UnsafeRawPointer) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is greater than or equal to that of the second argument.
